alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:34PM EST until December 19 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Delaware, including the following county, Sussex. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1133 PM EST, flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - For Nanticoke at Bridgeville: At 10:15pm the stage was 9.7 feet. Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
